summary: The Mental Health Emergency Responder Act (H.R. 5706) establishes a grant program to help local and Tribal governments, emergency medical services, and other eligible entities develop or expand behavioral health crisis response programs that minimize reliance on law enforcement. The bill outlines eligible uses for grant funds, including training behavioral health professionals, integrating co-response teams, providing community education, and establishing alternative response protocols. It also includes reporting requirements and prioritizes applications from areas lacking existing non-law enforcement programs. The bill authorizes appropriations for fiscal years 2026-2030.
